column4: would anyone possibly know how to move files from a hard drive to a usb external hard drive through terminal?
should be possible
is GUI not an option?
i'm pretty sure it is. it's probably sudo mv hd/home/ usb/home or something.. sadly gui is not an option
err... cp -a source dest
starting with Hardy, it's using gvfs for Gnome... but you're talking about Server or something?

i tried upgrading my computer, but it froze in the middle and now is stuck generating a locale, so i have to get to the hard drive take all mystuff off and put it onto a usb drive, then reformat the main drive, and bring all the files back on.
yeah, don't sweat it
you could boot a livecd and do that pretty easily
heh i'm on a live cd, and it says i don't have permissions to copy it from the hard drive
weird... maybe it wasn't cleanly unmounted
are you copying from an NTFS partition or something?
i'm not too sure, one is linux, the other might be windows
my the hd is linux and the usb is possibly from windows, pretty much out of the box.
if NTFS is not cleanly unmounted, you will need to boot into windows, reboot, boot into windows, reboot, boot into windows, reboot
otherwise it won't be readable from the Live CD
trying to get files off of linux hard drive.
oh ...  I wonder, how to browse as root user with nautilus?
is there a way to browse as root through nautilus (i'm on a live cd now)
that's what we need to figure out, I have no idea :/
from a terminal you could try "sudo nautilus"
